snippet: The Senate Judiciary Committee began looking into amendments intended to reshape legislation to overhaul the nation’s immigration laws.
abstract: Senate Judiciary Committee begins looking into amendments intended to reshape, and in some cases derail, legislation to overhaul nation's immigration laws; signs of bipartisanship emerge, with committee accepting at least eight Republican proposals to strengthen border security.
lead_paragraph: The Senate Judiciary Committee began looking into amendments intended to reshape legislation to overhaul the nation’s immigration laws.

headline.seo: Senate Judiciary Panel Focuses on Border Security
headline.main: Senate Bipartisanship on Display, Briefly, as Committee Focuses on Border Security
headline.print_headline: Senate Bipartisanship on Display, Briefly, as Committee Focuses on Border Security
